data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesDescription
data.value: An alias is an alternate name or nickname for a cmdlet or for a command element, such as a function, script, file, or executable file. An implicit alias is also the omission of the 'Get-' prefix for commands with this prefix. But when writing scripts that will potentially need to be maintained over time, either by the original author or another Windows PowerShell scripter, please consider using full cmdlet name instead of alias. Aliases can introduce these problems, readability, understandability and availability.

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Cmdlet Aliases or omitting the 'Get-' prefix.

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockDescription
data.value: Empty catch blocks are considered poor design decisions because if an error occurs in the try block, this error is simply swallowed and not acted upon. While this does not inherently lead to bad things. It can and this should be avoided if possible. To fix a violation of this rule, using Write-Error or throw statements in catch blocks.

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Empty Catch Block

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleDescription
data.value: The Invoke-Expression cmdlet evaluates or runs a specified string as a command and returns the results of the expression or command. It can be extraordinarily powerful so it is not that you want to never use it but you need to be very careful about using it. In particular, you are probably on safe ground if the data only comes from the program itself. If you include any data provided from the user - you need to protect yourself from Code Injection. To fix a violation of this rule, please remove Invoke-Expression from script and find other options instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Invoke-Expression

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersDescription
data.value: Readability and clarity should be the goal of any script we expect to maintain over time. When calling a command that takes parameters, where possible consider using name parameters as opposed to positional parameters. To fix a violation of this rule, please use named parameters instead of positional parameters when calling a command.

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Positional Parameters

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpDescription
data.value: Checks that all cmdlets have a help comment. This rule only checks existence. It does not check the content of the comment.

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' does not have a help comment.

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpCommonName
data.value: Basic Comment Help

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsDescription
data.value: Checks that all defined cmdlets use approved verbs. This is in line with PowerShell's best practices.

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses an unapproved verb.

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsCommonName
data.value: Cmdlet Verbs

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsDescription
data.value: Ensure declared variables are used elsewhere in the script and not just during assignment.

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsError
data.value: The variable '{0}' is assigned but never used.

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsCommonName
data.value: Extra Variables

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsDescription
data.value: Checks that global variables are not used. Global variables are strongly discouraged as they can cause errors across different systems.

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsError
data.value: Found global variable '{0}'.

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsCommonName
data.value: No Global Variables

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullDescription
data.value: Checks that $null is on the left side of any equaltiy comparisons (eq, ne, ceq, cne, ieq, ine). When there is an array on the left side of a null equality comparison, PowerShell will check for a $null IN the array rather than if the array is null. If the two sides of the comaprision are switched this is fixed. Therefore, $null should always be on the left side of equality comparisons just in case.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullError
data.value: $null should be on the left side of equality comparisons.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullCommonName
data.value: Null Comparison

data.name: OneCharDescription
data.value: Checks that cmdlets and parameters have more than one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorCmdlet
data.value: The cmdlet name '{0}' only has one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorParameter
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' has a parameter '{1}' that only has one character.

data.name: OneCharErrorParameterSB
data.value: A script block has a parameter '{0}' that only has one character.

data.name: OneCharCommonName
data.value: One Char

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeDescription
data.value: For PowerShell 4.0 and earlier, a parameter named Credential with type PSCredential must have a credential transformation attribute defined after the PSCredential type attribute.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeError
data.value: The Credential parameter in '{0}' must be of type PSCredential. For PowerShell 4.0 and earlier, please define a credential transformation attribute, e.g. [System.Management.Automation.Credential()], after the PSCredential type attribute.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeErrorSB
data.value: The Credential parameter found in the script block must be of type PSCredential. For PowerShell 4.0 and earlier please define a credential transformation attribute, e.g. [System.Management.Automation.Credential()], after the PSCredential type attribute.

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeCommonName
data.value: Use PSCredential type.

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharDescription
data.value: Checks for reserved characters in cmdlet names. These characters usually cause a parsing error. Otherwise they will generally cause runtime errors.

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses a reserved char in its name.

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharCommonName
data.value: Reserved Cmdlet Chars

data.name: ReservedParamsCmdletPrefix
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}'

data.name: ReservedParamsDescription
data.value: Checks for reserved parameters in function definitions. If these parameters are defined by the user, an error generally occurs.

data.name: ReservedParamsError
data.value: '{0}' defines the reserved common parameter '{1}'.

data.name: ReservedParamsCommonName
data.value: Reserved Parameters

data.name: ReservedParamsScriptPrefix
data.value: The script

data.name: ShouldProcessDescription
data.value: Checks that if the SupportsShouldProcess is present, the function calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue and vice versa. Scripts with one or the other but not both will generally run into an error or unexpected behavior.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasAttribute
data.value: '{0}' has the ShouldProcess attribute but does not call ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasAttributeSB
data.value: A script block has the ShouldProcess attribute but does not call ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasCmdlet
data.value: '{0}' calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue but does not have the ShouldProcess attribute.

data.name: ShouldProcessErrorHasCmdletSB
data.value: A script block calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue but does not have the ShouldProcess attribute.

data.name: ShouldProcessCommonName
data.value: Should Process

data.name: SourceName
data.value: PS

data.name: UseVerboseMessageInDSCResourceDescription
data.value: It is a best practice to emit informative, verbose messages in DSC resource functions. This helps in debugging issues when a DSC configuration is executed.

data.name: UseVerboseMessageInDSCResourceErrorFunction
data.value: There is no call to Write-Verbose in DSC function '{0}'. If you are using Write-Verbose in a helper function, suppress this rule application.

data.name: UseVerboseMessageInDSCResourceCommonName
data.value: Use verbose message in DSC resource

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldDescription
data.value: Some fields of the module manifest (such as ModuleVersion) are required.

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldCommonName
data.value: Module Manifest Fields

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleDescription
data.value: If a script file is in a PowerShell module folder, then that folder must be loadable.

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleError
data.value: Cannot load the module '{0}' that file '{1}' is in.

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleCommonName
data.value: Module Must Be Loadable

data.name: NullErrorMessage
data.value: Error Message is Null.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordDescription
data.value: Password parameters that take in plaintext will expose passwords and compromise the security of your system.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordError
data.value: Parameter '{0}' should use SecureString, otherwise this will expose sensitive information. See ConvertTo-SecureString for more information.

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Plain Text For Password Parameter

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextDescription
data.value: Using ConvertTo-SecureString with plain text will expose secure information.

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextError
data.value: File '{0}' uses ConvertTo-SecureString with plaintext. This will expose secure information. Encrypted standard strings should be used instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using SecureString With Plain Text

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterDescription
data.value: Switch parameter should not default to true.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterError
data.value: File '{0}' has a switch parameter default to true.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterCommonName
data.value: Switch Parameters Should Not Default To True

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForceDescription
data.value: Functions that use ShouldContinue should have a boolean force parameter to allow user to bypass it.

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForceError
data.value: Function '{0}' in file '{1}' uses ShouldContinue but does not have a boolean force parameter. The force parameter will allow users of the script to bypass ShouldContinue prompt

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForceCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using ShouldContinue Without Boolean Force Parameter

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostDescription
data.value: Using Clear-Host is not recommended because the cmdlet may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all.

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Clear-Host. This is not recommended because it may not work in some hosts or there may even be no hosts at all.

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Clear-Host

data.name: AvoidUsingConsoleWriteError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Console.'{1}'. Using Console to write is not recommended because it may not work in all hosts or there may even be no hosts at all. Use Write-Output instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostDescription
data.value: Avoid using the Write-Host cmdlet. Instead, use Write-Output, Write-Verbose, or Write-Information. Because Write-Host is host-specific, its implementation might vary unpredictably. Also, prior to PowerShell 5.0, Write-Host did not write to a stream, so users cannot suppress it, capture its value, or redirect it.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostError
data.value: File '{0}' uses Write-Host. Avoid using Write-Host because it might not work in all hosts, does not work when there is no host, and (prior to PS 5.0) cannot be suppressed, captured, or redirected. Instead, use Write-Output, Write-Verbose, or Write-Information.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Write-Host

data.name: UseSingularNounsDescription
data.value: Cmdlet should use singular instead of plural nouns.

data.name: UseSingularNounsError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' uses a plural noun. A singular noun should be used instead.

data.name: UseSingularNounsCommonName
data.value: Cmdlet Singular Noun

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesName
data.value: AvoidUsingCmdletAliases

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterName
data.value: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameter

data.name: AvoidGlobalVarsName
data.value: AvoidGlobalVars

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForceName
data.value: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForce

data.name: AvoidUnloadableModuleName
data.value: AvoidUnloadableModule

data.name: AvoidUsingClearHostName
data.value: AvoidUsingClearHost

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextName
data.value: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainText

data.name: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlockName
data.value: AvoidUsingEmptyCatchBlock

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionRuleName
data.value: AvoidUsingInvokeExpression

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordName
data.value: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPassword

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersName
data.value: AvoidUsingPositionalParameters

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostName
data.value: AvoidUsingWriteHost

data.name: OneCharName
data.value: OneChar

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullName
data.value: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNull

data.name: ProvideCommentHelpName
data.value: ProvideCommentHelp

data.name: ReservedCmdletCharName
data.value: ReservedCmdletChar

data.name: ReservedParamsName
data.value: ReservedParams

data.name: ShouldProcessName
data.value: ShouldProcess

data.name: UseApprovedVerbsName
data.value: UseApprovedVerbs

data.name: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignmentsName
data.value: UseDeclaredVarsMoreThanAssignments

data.name: UsePSCredentialTypeName
data.value: UsePSCredentialType

data.name: UseSingularNounsName
data.value: UseSingularNouns

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldName
data.value: MissingModuleManifestField

data.name: UseVerboseMessageInDSCResourceName
data.value: UseVerboseMessageInDSCResource

data.name: CommandNotFoundCommonName
data.value: Command Not Found

data.name: CommandNotFoundDescription
data.value: Commands that are undefined or do not exist should not be used.

data.name: CommandNotFoundError
data.value: Command '{0}' Is Not Found

data.name: CommandNotFoundName
data.value: CommandNotFound

data.name: TypeNotFoundCommonName
data.value: Type Not Found

data.name: TypeNotFoundDescription
data.value: Undefined type should not be used

data.name: TypeNotFoundError
data.value: Type '{0}' is not found. Please check that it is defined.

data.name: TypeNotFoundName
data.value: TypeNotFound

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyCommonName
data.value: Use Cmdlet Correctly

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyDescription
data.value: Cmdlet should be called with the mandatory parameters.

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyError
data.value: Cmdlet '{0}' may be used incorrectly. Please check that all mandatory parameters are supplied.

data.name: UseCmdletCorrectlyName
data.value: UseCmdletCorrectly

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentCommonName
data.value: Use Type At Variable Assignment

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentDescription
data.value: Types should be specified at variable assignments to maintain readability and maintainability of script.

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentError
data.value: Specify type at the assignment of variable '{0}'

data.name: UseTypeAtVariableAssignmentName
data.value: UseTypeAtVariableAssignment

data.name: AvoidUsernameAndPasswordParamsCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Username and Password Parameters

data.name: AvoidUsernameAndPasswordParamsDescription
data.value: Functions should take in a Credential parameter of type PSCredential (with a Credential transformation attribute defined after it in PowerShell 4.0 or earlier) or set the Password parameter to type SecureString.

data.name: AvoidUsernameAndPasswordParamsError
data.value: Function '{0}' has both Username and Password parameters. Either set the type of the Password parameter to SecureString or replace the Username and Password parameters with a Credential parameter of type PSCredential. If using a Credential parameter in PowerShell 4.0 or earlier, please define a credential transformation attribute after the PSCredential type attribute.

data.name: AvoidUsernameAndPasswordParamsName
data.value: AvoidUsingUsernameAndPasswordParams

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersCommonName
data.value: Avoid Invoking Empty Members

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersDescription
data.value: Invoking non-constant members would cause potential bugs. Please double check the syntax to make sure members invoked are non-constant.

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersError
data.value: '{0}' has non-constant members. Invoking non-constant members may cause bugs in the script.

data.name: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembersName
data.value: AvoidInvokingEmptyMembers

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using ComputerName Hardcoded

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedDescription
data.value: The ComputerName parameter of a cmdlet should not be hardcoded as this will expose sensitive information about the system.

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedError
data.value: The ComputerName parameter of cmdlet '{0}' is hardcoded. This will expose sensitive information about the system if the script is shared.

data.name: AvoidComputerNameHardcodedName
data.value: AvoidUsingComputerNameHardcoded

data.name: AvoidEmptyCatchBlockError
data.value: Empty catch block is used. Please use Write-Error or throw statements in catch blocks.

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesError
data.value: '{0}' is an alias of '{1}'. Alias can introduce possible problems and make scripts hard to maintain. Please consider changing alias to its full content.

data.name: AvoidUsingInvokeExpressionError
data.value: Invoke-Expression is used. Please remove Invoke-Expression from script and find other options instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingPositionalParametersError
data.value: Cmdlet '{0}' has positional parameter. Please use named parameters instead of positional parameters when calling a command.

data.name: NullAstErrorMessage
data.value: Cannot process null Ast

data.name: NullCommandInfoError
data.value: Cannot process null CommandInfo

data.name: DSCSourceName
data.value: PSDSC

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceCommonName
data.value: Use Standard Get/Set/Test TargetResource functions in DSC Resource

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceDescription
data.value: DSC Resource must implement Get, Set and Test-TargetResource functions. DSC Class must implement Get, Set and Test functions.

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceError
data.value: Missing '{0}' function. DSC Resource must implement Get, Set and Test-TargetResource functions.

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInResourceName
data.value: StandardDSCFunctionsInResource

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Internal URLs

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsDescription
data.value: Using Internal URLs in the scripts may cause security problems.

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsError
data.value: '{0}' could be an internal URL. Using internal URL directly in the script may cause potential information disclosure.

data.name: AvoidUsingInternalURLsName
data.value: AvoidUsingInternalURLs

data.name: SharepointURL
data.value: www.sharepoint.com

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCCommonName
data.value: Use Identical Parameters For DSC Test and Set Functions

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCDescription
data.value: The Test and Set-TargetResource functions of DSC Resource must have the same parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCError
data.value: The Test and Set-TargetResource functions of DSC Resource must have the same parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalParametersDSCName
data.value: UseIdenticalParametersForDSC

data.name: UseStandardDSCFunctionsInClassError
data.value: Missing '{0}' function. DSC Class must implement Get, Set and Test functions.

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCCommonName
data.value: Use identical mandatory parameters for DSC Get/Test/Set TargetResource functions

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCDescription
data.value: The Get/Test/Set TargetResource functions of DSC resource must have the same mandatory parameters.

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCError
data.value: The '{0}' parameter '{1}' is not present in '{2}' DSC resource function(s).

data.name: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersDSCName
data.value: UseIdenticalMandatoryParametersForDSC

data.name: NotAllCodePathReturnsDSCFunctionsError
data.value: Not all code path in {0} function in DSC Class {1} returns a value

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypeDSCFunctionsName
data.value: ReturnCorrectTypesForDSCFunctions

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForDSCFunctionsCommonName
data.value: Return Correct Types For DSC Functions

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForDSCFunctionsDescription
data.value: Set function in DSC class and Set-TargetResource in DSC resource must not return anything. Get function in DSC class must return an instance of the DSC class and Get-TargetResource function in DSC resource must return a hashtable. Test function in DSC class and Get-TargetResource function in DSC resource must return a boolean.

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForDSCFunctionsNoTypeError
data.value: {0} function in DSC Class {1} should return object of type {2}

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForDSCFunctionsWrongTypeError
data.value: {0} function in DSC Class {1} should return object of type {2} instead of type {3}

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForSetFunctionsDSCError
data.value: Set function in DSC Class {0} should not return anything

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForGetTestTargetResourceFunctionsDSCResourceError
data.value: {0} function in DSC Resource should return object of type {1} instead of {2}

data.name: ReturnCorrectTypesForSetTargetResourceFunctionsDSCError
data.value: Set-TargetResource function in DSC Resource should not output anything to the pipeline.

data.name: UseShouldProcessForStateChangingFunctionsCommonName
data.value: Use ShouldProcess For State Changing Functions

data.name: UseShouldProcessForStateChangingFunctionsDescrption
data.value: Functions that have verbs like New, Start, Stop, Set, Reset, Restart that change system state should support 'ShouldProcess'.

data.name: UseShouldProcessForStateChangingFunctionsError
data.value: Function '{0}' has verb that could change system state. Therefore, the function has to support 'ShouldProcess'.

data.name: UseShouldProcessForStateChangingFunctionsName
data.value: UseShouldProcessForStateChangingFunctions

data.name: AvoidUsingWMICmdletCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Get-WMIObject, Remove-WMIObject, Invoke-WmiMethod, Register-WmiEvent, Set-WmiInstance

data.name: AvoidUsingWMICmdletDescription
data.value: Deprecated. Starting in Windows PowerShell 3.0, these cmdlets have been superseded by CIM cmdlets.

data.name: AvoidUsingWMICmdletError
data.value: File '{0}' uses WMI cmdlet. For PowerShell 3.0 and above, use CIM cmdlet which perform the same tasks as the WMI cmdlets. The CIM cmdlets comply with WS-Management (WSMan) standards and with the Common Information Model (CIM) standard, which enables the cmdlets to use the same techniques to manage Windows computers and those running other operating systems.

data.name: AvoidUsingWMICmdletName
data.value: AvoidUsingWMICmdlet

data.name: UseOutputTypeCorrectlyCommonName
data.value: Use OutputType Correctly

data.name: UseOutputTypeCorrectlyDescription
data.value: The return types of a cmdlet should be declared using the OutputType attribute.

data.name: UseOutputTypeCorrectlyError
data.value: The cmdlet '{0}' returns an object of type '{1}' but this type is not declared in the OutputType attribute.

data.name: UseOutputTypeCorrectlyName
data.value: UseOutputTypeCorrectly

data.name: DscTestsPresent
data.value: DscTestsPresent

data.name: DscTestsPresentCommonName
data.value: Dsc tests are present

data.name: DscTestsPresentDescription
data.value: Every DSC resource module should contain folder "Tests" with tests for every resource. Test scripts should have resource name they are testing in the file name.

data.name: DscTestsPresentNoTestsError
data.value: No tests found for resource '{0}'

data.name: DscExamplesPresent
data.value: DscExamplesPresent

data.name: DscExamplesPresentCommonName
data.value: DSC examples are present

data.name: DscExamplesPresentDescription
data.value: Every DSC resource module should contain folder "Examples" with sample configurations for every resource. Sample configurations should have resource name they are demonstrating in the title.

data.name: DscExamplesPresentNoExamplesError
data.value: No examples found for resource '{0}'

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueForMandatoryParameterCommonName
data.value: Avoid Default Value For Mandatory Parameter

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueForMandatoryParameterDescription
data.value: Mandatory parameter should not be initialized with a default value in the param block because this value will be ignored.. To fix a violation of this rule, please avoid initializing a value for the mandatory parameter in the param block.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueForMandatoryParameterError
data.value: Mandatory Parameter '{0}' is initialized in the Param block. To fix a violation of this rule, please leave it uninitialized.

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueForMandatoryParameterName
data.value: AvoidDefaultValueForMandatoryParameter

data.name: AvoidUsingDeprecatedManifestFieldsCommonName
data.value: Avoid Using Deprecated Manifest Fields

data.name: AvoidUsingDeprecatedManifestFieldsDescription
data.value: "ModuleToProcess" is obsolete in the latest PowerShell version. Please update with the latest field "RootModule" in manifest files to avoid PowerShell version inconsistency.

data.name: AvoidUsingDeprecatedManifestFieldsName
data.value: AvoidUsingDeprecatedManifestFields

data.name: UseUTF8EncodingForHelpFileCommonName
data.value: Use UTF8 Encoding For Help File

data.name: UseUTF8EncodingForHelpFileDescription
data.value: PowerShell help file needs to use UTF8 Encoding.

data.name: UseUTF8EncodingForHelpFileError
data.value: File {0} has to use UTF8 instead of {1} encoding because it is a powershell help file.

data.name: UseUTF8EncodingForHelpFileName
data.value: UseUTF8EncodingForHelpFile

data.name: UseBOMForUnicodeEncodedFileCommonName
data.value: Use BOM encoding for non-ASCII files

data.name: UseBOMForUnicodeEncodedFileDescription
data.value: For a file encoded with a format other than ASCII, ensure BOM is present to ensure that any application consuming this file can interpret it correctly.

data.name: UseBOMForUnicodeEncodedFileError
data.value: Missing BOM encoding for non-ASCII encoded file '{0}'

data.name: UseBOMForUnicodeEncodedFileName
data.value: UseBOMForUnicodeEncodedFile

data.name: AvoidDefaultValueSwitchParameterErrorScriptDefinition
data.value: Script definition has a switch parameter default to true.

data.name: AvoidShouldContinueWithoutForceErrorScriptDefinition
data.value: Function '{0}' in script definition uses ShouldContinue but does not have a boolean force parameter. The force parameter will allow users of the script to bypass ShouldContinue prompt

data.name: AvoidUsingConvertToSecureStringWithPlainTextErrorScriptDefinition
data.value: Script definition uses ConvertTo-SecureString with plaintext. This will expose secure information. Encrypted standard strings should be used instead.

data.name: AvoidUsingWMICmdletErrorScriptDefinition
data.value: Script definition uses WMI cmdlet. For PowerShell 3.0 and above, use CIM cmdlet which perform the same tasks as the WMI cmdlets. The CIM cmdlets comply with WS-Management (WSMan) standards and with the Common Information Model (CIM) standard, which enables the cmdlets to use the same techniques to manage Windows computers and those running other operating systems.

data.name: AvoidUsingWriteHostErrorScriptDefinition
data.value: Script definition uses Write-Host. Avoid using Write-Host because it might not work in all hosts, does not work when there is no host, and (prior to PS 5.0) cannot be suppressed, captured, or redirected. Instead, use Write-Output, Write-Verbose, or Write-Information.

data.name: ScriptDefinitionName
data.value: ScriptDefinition

data.name: MisleadingBacktickCommonName
data.value: Misleading Backtick

data.name: MisleadingBacktickDescription
data.value: Ending a line with an escaped whitepsace character is misleading. A trailing backtick is usually used for line continuation. Users typically don't intend to end a line with escaped whitespace.

data.name: MisleadingBacktickName
data.value: MisleadingBacktick

data.name: MisleadingBacktickError
data.value: This line has a backtick at the end trailed by a whitespace character. Did you mean for this to be a line continuation?

data.name: AvoidNullOrEmptyHelpMessageAttributeCommonName
data.value: Avoid using null or empty HelpMessage parameter attribute.

data.name: AvoidNullOrEmptyHelpMessageAttributeDescription
data.value: Setting the HelpMessage attribute to an empty string or null value causes PowerShell interpreter to throw an error while executing the corresponding function.

data.name: AvoidNullOrEmptyHelpMessageAttributeError
data.value: HelpMessage parameter attribute should not be null or empty. To fix a violation of this rule, please set its value to a non-empty string.

data.name: AvoidNullOrEmptyHelpMessageAttributeName
data.value: AvoidNullOrEmptyHelpMessageAttribute

data.name: UseToExportFieldsInManifestCommonName
data.value: Use the *ToExport module manifest fields.

data.name: UseToExportFieldsInManifestDescription
data.value: In a module manifest, AliasesToExport, CmdletsToExport, FunctionsToExport and VariablesToExport fields should not use wildcards or $null in their entries. During module auto-discovery, if any of these entries are missing or $null or wildcard, PowerShell does some potentially expensive work to analyze the rest of the module.

data.name: UseToExportFieldsInManifestError
data.value: Do not use wildcard or $null in this field. Explicitly specify a list for {0}.

data.name: UseToExportFieldsInManifestName
data.value: UseToExportFieldsInManifest

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesCorrectionDescription
data.value: Replace {0} with {1}

data.name: AvoidUsingPlainTextForPasswordCorrectionDescription
data.value: Set {0} type to SecureString

data.name: MissingModuleManifestFieldCorrectionDescription
data.value: Add {0} = {1} to the module manifest

data.name: UseToExportFieldsInManifestCorrectionDescription
data.value: Replace {0} with {1}

data.name: UseLiteralInitilializerForHashtableCommonName
data.value: Create hashtables with literal initializers

data.name: UseLiteralInitilializerForHashtableDescription
data.value: Use literal initializer, @{{}}, for creating a hashtable as they are case-insensitive by default

data.name: UseLiteralInitilializerForHashtableError
data.value: Create hashtables with literal initliazers

data.name: UseLiteralInitilializerForHashtableName
data.value: UseLiteralInitializerForHashtable

data.name: UseCompatibleCmdletsName

data.name: UseCompatibleCmdletsCommonName
data.value: Use compatible cmdlets

data.name: UseCompatibleCmdletsDescription
data.value: Use cmdlets compatible with the given PowerShell version and edition and operating system

data.name: UseCompatibleCmdletsError
data.value: '{0}' is not compatible with PowerShell edition '{1}', version '{2}' and OS '{3}'

data.value: AvoidOverwritingBuiltInCmdlets

data.name: AvoidOverwritingBuiltInCmdletsCommonName
data.value: Avoid overwriting built in cmdlets

data.value: Do not overwrite the definition of a cmdlet that is included with PowerShell

data.name: AvoidOverwritingBuiltInCmdletsError
data.value: '{0}' is a cmdlet that is included with PowerShell (version {1}) whose definition should not be overridden

data.name: UseCompatibleCommandsName
data.value: UseCompatibleCommands

data.name: UseCompatibleCommandsCommonName
data.value: Use compatible commands

data.name: UseCompatibleCommandsDescription
data.value: Use commands compatible with the given PowerShell version and operating system

data.name: UseCompatibleCommandsCommandError
data.value: The command '{0}' is not available by default in PowerShell version '{1}' on platform '{2}'

data.name: UseCompatibleCommandsParameterError

data.name: UseCompatibleTypesMemberError
data.value: The member '{0}' is not available on type '{1}' by default in PowerShell version '{2}' on platform '{3}'

data.name: UseCompatibleSyntaxName
data.value: UseCompatibleSyntax

data.name: UseCompatibleSyntaxCommonName
data.value: Use compatible syntax

data.name: UseCompatibleSyntaxDescription
data.value: Use script syntax compatible with the given PowerShell versions

data.name: UseCompatibleSyntaxError
data.value: The {0} syntax '{1}' is not available by default in PowerShell versions {2}

data.name: UseCompatibleSyntaxCorrection
data.value: Use the '{0}' syntax instead for compatibility with PowerShell versions {1}

data.name: UseCompatibleTypesTypeAcceleratorError

data.name: AvoidGlobalFunctionsCommonName
data.value: Avoid global functiosn and aliases

data.name: AvoidGlobalFunctionsDescription
data.value: Checks that global functions and aliases are not used. Global functions are strongly discouraged as they can cause errors across different systems.

data.name: AvoidGlobalFunctionsError
data.value: Avoid creating functions with a Global scope.

data.name: AvoidGlobalFunctionsName
data.value: AvoidGlobalFunctions

data.name: AvoidGlobalAliasesCommonName
data.value: Avoid global aliases.

data.name: AvoidGlobalAliasesDescription
data.value: Checks that global aliases are not used. Global aliases are strongly discouraged as they overwrite desired aliases with name conflicts.

data.name: AvoidGlobalAliasesError
data.value: Avoid creating aliases with a Global scope.

data.name: AvoidGlobalAliasesName
data.value: AvoidGlobalAliases

data.name: AvoidTrailingWhitespaceName
data.value: AvoidTrailingWhitespace

data.name: AvoidTrailingWhitespaceCommonName
data.value: Avoid trailing whitespace

data.name: AvoidTrailingWhitespaceDescription
data.value: Each line should have no trailing whitespace.

data.name: AvoidTrailingWhitespaceError
data.value: Line has trailing whitespace

data.name: AvoidLongLinesName
data.value: AvoidLongLines

data.name: AvoidLongLinesCommonName
data.value: Avoid long lines

data.name: AvoidLongLinesDescription
data.value: Line lengths should be less than the configured maximum

data.name: AvoidLongLinesError
data.value: Line exceeds the configured maximum length of {0} characters

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceName
data.value: PlaceOpenBrace

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceCommonName
data.value: Place open braces consistently

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceDescription
data.value: Place open braces either on the same line as the preceding expression or on a new line.

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceErrorShouldBeOnSameLine
data.value: Open brace not on same line as preceding keyword. It should be on the same line.

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceErrorShouldNotBeOnSameLine
data.value: Open brace is not on a new line.

data.name: PlaceOpenBraceErrorNoNewLineAfterBrace
data.value: There is no new line after open brace.

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceName
data.value: PlaceCloseBrace

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceCommonName
data.value: Place close braces

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceDescription
data.value: Close brace should be on a new line by itself.

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceErrorShouldBeOnNewLine
data.value: Close brace is not on a new line.

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceErrorShouldNotFollowEmptyLine
data.value: Close brace does not follow a non-empty line.

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceErrorShouldFollowNewLine
data.value: Close brace does not follow a new line.

data.name: PlaceCloseBraceErrorShouldCuddleBranchStatement
data.value: Close brace before a branch statement is followed by a new line.

data.name: UseConsistentIndentationName
data.value: UseConsistentIndentation

data.name: UseConsistentIndentationCommonName
data.value: Use consistent indentation

data.name: UseConsistentIndentationDescription
data.value: Each statement block should have a consistent indenation.

data.name: UseConsistentIndentationError
data.value: Indentation not consistent

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceName
data.value: UseConsistentWhitespace

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceCommonName
data.value: Use whitespaces

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceDescription
data.value: Check for whitespace between keyword and open paren/curly, around assigment operator ('='), around arithmetic operators and after separators (',' and ';')

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorBeforeOpeningBrace
data.value: Use space before open brace.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorBeforeParen
data.value: Use space before open parenthesis.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorOperator
data.value: Use space before and after binary and assignment operators.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorSeparatorComma
data.value: Use space after a comma.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorSeparatorSemi
data.value: Use space after a semicolon.

data.name: UseSupportsShouldProcessName
data.value: UseSupportsShouldProcess

data.name: UseSupportsShouldProcessCommonName
data.value: Use SupportsShouldProcess

data.name: UseSupportsShouldProcessDescription
data.value: Commands typically provide Confirm and Whatif parameters to give more control on its execution in an interactive environment. In PowerShell, a command can use a SupportsShouldProcess attribute to provide this capability. Hence, manual addition of these parameters to a command is discouraged. If a commands need Confirm and Whatif parameters, then it should support ShouldProcess.

data.name: UseSupportsShouldProcessError
data.value: Whatif and/or Confirm manually defined in function {0}. Instead, please use SupportsShouldProcess attribute.

data.name: AlignAssignmentStatementName
data.value: AlignAssignmentStatement

data.name: AlignAssignmentStatementCommonName
data.value: Align assignment statement

data.name: AlignAssignmentStatementDescription
data.value: Line up assignment statements such that the assignment operator are aligned.

data.name: AlignAssignmentStatementError
data.value: Assignment statements are not aligned

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfAssignmentOperatorCommonName
data.value: '=' is not an assignment operator. Did you mean the equality operator '-eq'?

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfAssignmentOperatorName
data.value: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfAssignmentOperator

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToReadOnlyAutomaticVariable
data.value: Use a different variable name

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToReadOnlyAutomaticVariableCommonName
data.value: Changing automtic variables might have undesired side effects

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToReadOnlyAutomaticVariableDescription
data.value: This automatic variables is built into PowerShell and readonly.

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToReadOnlyAutomaticVariableError
data.value: The Variable '{0}' cannot be assigned since it is a readonly automatic variable that is built into PowerShell, please use a different name.

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToAutomaticVariableName
data.value: AvoidAssignmentToAutomaticVariable

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToReadOnlyAutomaticVariableIntroducedInPowerShell6_0Error
data.value: Starting from PowerShell 6.0, the Variable '{0}' cannot be assigned any more since it is a readonly automatic variable that is built into PowerShell, please use a different name.

data.name: AvoidUsingCmdletAliasesMissingGetPrefixError
data.value: '{0}' is implicitly aliasing '{1}' because it is missing the 'Get-' prefix. This can introduce possible problems and make scripts hard to maintain. Please consider changing command to its full name.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfAssignmentOperatorDescription
data.value: '=' or '==' are not comparison operators in the PowerShell language and rarely needed inside conditional statements.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfAssignmentOperatorError
data.value: Did you mean to use the assignment operator '='? The equality operator in PowerShell is 'eq'.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfRedirectionOperatorCommonName
data.value: '>' is not a comparison operator. Use '-gt' (greater than) or '-ge' (greater or equal).

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfRedirectionOperatorDescription
data.value: When switching between different languages it is easy to forget that '>' does not mean 'great than' in PowerShell.

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfRedirectionOperatorError
data.value: Did you mean to use the redirection operator '>'? The comparison operators in PowerShell are '-gt' (greater than) or '-ge' (greater or equal).

data.name: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfRedirectionOperatorName
data.value: PossibleIncorrectUsageOfRedirectionOperator

data.name: PossibleIncorrectComparisonWithNullSuggesteCorrectionDescription
data.value: Use $null on the left hand side for safe comparison with $null.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorAfterOpeningBrace
data.value: Use space after open brace.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorBeforeClosingInnerBrace
data.value: Use space before closing brace.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorSpaceAfterPipe
data.value: Use space after pipe.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorSpaceBeforePipe
data.value: Use space before pipe.

data.name: UseCorrectCasingCommonName
data.value: Use exact casing of cmdlet/function/parameter name.

data.name: UseCorrectCasingDescription
data.value: For better readability and consistency, use the exact casing of the cmdlet/function/parameter.

data.name: UseCorrectCasingError
data.value: Cmdlet/Function/Parameter does not match its exact casing '{0}'.

data.name: UseCorrectCasingName
data.value: UseCorrectCasing

data.name: UseProcessBlockForPipelineCommandCommonName
data.value: Use process block for command that accepts input from pipeline.

data.name: UseProcessBlockForPipelineCommandDescription
data.value: If a command parameter takes its value from the pipeline, the command must use a process block to bind the input objects from the pipeline to that parameter.

data.name: UseProcessBlockForPipelineCommandError
data.value: Command accepts pipeline input but has not defined a process block.

data.name: UseProcessBlockForPipelineCommandName
data.value: UseProcessBlockForPipelineCommand

data.name: AvoidAssignmentToWritableAutomaticVariableError
data.value: The Variable '{0}' is an automatic variable that is built into PowerShell, assigning to it might have undesired side effects. If assignment is not by design, please use a different name.

data.name: UseConsistentWhitespaceErrorSpaceBetweenParameter
data.value: Use only 1 whitespace between parameter names or values.

data.name: ReviewUnusedParameterCommonName
data.value: ReviewUnusedParameter

data.name: ReviewUnusedParameterDescription
data.value: Ensure all parameters are used within the same script, scriptblock, or function where they are declared.

data.name: ReviewUnusedParameterError
data.value: The parameter '{0}' has been declared but not used.

data.name: ReviewUnusedParameterName
data.value: ReviewUnusedParameter

data.name: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspacesCommonName
data.value: Use 'Using:' scope modifier in RunSpace ScriptBlocks

data.name: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspacesDescription
data.value: If a ScriptBlock is intended to be run as a new RunSpace, variables inside it should use 'Using:' scope modifier, or be initialized within the ScriptBlock.

data.name: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspacesName
data.value: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspaces

data.name: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspacesError
data.value: The variable '{0}' is not declared within this ScriptBlock, and is missing the 'Using:' scope modifier.

data.name: UseUsingScopeModifierInNewRunspacesCorrectionDescription
data.value: Replace {0} with {1}

data.name: AvoidUsingDoubleQuotesForConstantStringCommonName
data.value: Avoid using double quotes if the string is constant.

data.name: AvoidUsingDoubleQuotesForConstantStringDescription
data.value: Use single quotes if the string is constant.

data.name: AvoidUsingDoubleQuotesForConstantStringName
data.value: AvoidUsingDoubleQuotesForConstantString

data.name: AvoidUsingDoubleQuotesForConstantStringError
data.value: Use single quotes when a string is constant.
